column4: My VNC server won't work. I try to connect to it, it says unable to connect. I try to run Xvnc, it says it's running on display 0 -- so why won't it connect?
he's using a USB drive, kitche
I know that but if he has SATA his drives will be different
use the official drivers since the beta are no longer beta
good call! they in the repos?
sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx tells me i have the newest versoin..
oh.. where do i get them?
it's on the official site there might be a 3rd party repo that has them
what gnome res picker does not even look at xorg.conf res just remove all the res from /etc/X11/xorg.conf and just put int he resolution you want to use
is there another program i could use, or perhaps a cli program built in that i could use?
you can do sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and reconfigure xorg and just make sure your resolution is there for the resolution that xorg can use at least that's how some advance users just do it
i edited my xorg manually. i just tried to use xrandr and it says the mode is not available.
i just used dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, and removed all but 1280x1024 resolutions, and inputted the correct refresh rates, and it's still at 1024x768 :\
i just used dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, and removed all but 1280x1024 resolutions, and inputted the correct refresh rates, and it's still at 1024x768 :\
